article.headline: Lamar 82, Texas State 77
article.story: BEAUMONT, Texas (AP) -- Gil Goodrich scored 27 points, including six 3-pointers, to lead Lamar to an 82-77 win over Texas State Wednesday night. The game was tied at 34-34 at halftime and Lamar (10-12, 4-5 Southland) took a 37-34 lead when Goodrich hit a 3-pointer with 18:13 remaining. Lamar led the rest of the game, but Texas State (11-9, 6-3) threatened late before the Cardinals made five free throws in the game's final minute to secure the win. Lamar made a season-high 11 3-pointers with Raymond Anthony and Blake Whittle adding two apiece. Whittle finished with 14 points and five assists and Anthony had 13 points and four steals. Terry Conerway had 15 points for Texas State and Nick Ponder had 12.
